content.description: 4th class downclimb beside the waterfall, provides easy access to the base of the southeast side of the rock.  Don't slip on the smooth rock at the falls edges or you'll have a 50' ride to the base of the falls.
content.location: From the approaching trail head directly to the waterfall.

content.description:
Left Triplet 5.12-: Over-hung slopers and small crimpers up the arete

Center Triplet 5.13a: An almost sheer face with a couple of holds that will take some potential dyno's

Right Triplet 5.10a: The closest to the falls, this route is smooth from water erosion but is the easier of the three. With multiple ledges and good hand holds.
content.protection: TR anchor to a boulder at the top of the routes.
content.location: These bad boy routes are located on the right face, closest to the falls and pool.

content.description:
Good hard boulder problem moves with ledges in between sections of the climb.

BETA: starting at the arete use holds on the edge and by the small finger crack to get to the first ledge. From there go forwards to the corner and climb slightly out to the right to top the second ledge. A quick move to top the third ledge and you have made it to the crux. multiple side pulls and underclings to reach the top with barely any feet.
content.protection: Anchor to boulders at the top of the cliff
content.location: This route is on the center face following the arete to the left of the short finger crack. From the start the route goes straight ahead to the TR (top rope) anchor at the top.

content.description: Mostly some tipsy side pulls and large moves. The crux is right at the top of the main face where it becomes more of a 5.8- climb.
content.protection: Boulder anchors at top for TR
content.location: This route is located on the center face left of Stop 'n' Go. There is a Spongy looking rock a third of the way up the route above the start.

content.description: smooth climb to a fissure that leads to the top. Hand crack heading up and to the right.
content.protection: TR a boulder anchor at the top of the route
content.location: Left most route on the face; shown on BETA photo
